content.raw: [@Ian ](https://bitbucket.org/iche033/), at last, with the help of your last note, I was able to get it all working locally.  roscore runs, the nodes launch, two way comm is working.  It's too late tonight to risk a cloudsim session, but I will try that tomorrow.  Assuming that works, the last bit of the puzzle is how to access a roscore from the OCU.  If we can somehow see the roscore on the sim computer from the OCU, then we are all set.  If not, then the question is whether starting my own roscore on port 8001 in the FC and directing the FC to use it with ROS_MASTER_URI=http://192.168.2.10:8001 will cause the FC to be unable to hear the topics we need (such as the satellite dish goals) from the sim computer and perhaps be unable to send things like skipping checkpoints.
content.html: @Ian , at last, with the help of your last note, I was able to get it all working locally. roscore runs, the nodes launch, two way comm is working. It's too late tonight to risk a cloudsim session, but I will try that tomorrow. Assuming that works, the last bit of the puzzle is how to access a roscore from the OCU. If we can somehow see the roscore on the sim computer from the OCU, then we are all set. If not, then the question is whether starting my own roscore on port 8001 in the FC and directing the FC to use it with ROS_MASTER_URI=http://192.168.2.10:8001 will cause the FC to be unable to hear the topics we need (such as the satellite dish goals) from the sim computer and perhaps be unable to send things like skipping checkpoints.
